Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan has the upper hand over New Zealand with 7 victories in 9 WC matches.
New Zealand won their opening four encounters but are now on a mini-slump while Pakistan has three victories in seven outings so far.

Premier seamer Matt Henry ruled out of the remainder of the competition due to a hamstring injury. Tall pacer Kyle Jamieson has replaced him in the squad and may well find a place straightaway into the playing XI.
Having lost their previous four matches, Babar Azam and his men finally returned to winning ways when they defeated Bangladesh last time out.
This has suddenly turned out to be a mouth-watering and exciting fixture with both sides desperately looking for that two points.
